answers.answer: As long as he increased his intake and is sleeping well I would not worry--is he also having enough wet diapers in a day?  As long as weight gain is consisitent I would not worry--he is just demanding what he wants on his own schedule.

How premature was he?  If he is 3 months old it is probley about time for him to go longer inbetween feedings, but since he was a premie, you might want to check with your Dr. office and see what they recomend.  If you don't mind me asking why was he born early?
He was 5 and 2/7 weeks early. Mama had all kinds of problems, gestational diabetes, pre-eclampsia, baby was completely butt-breech, cord around his neck three times... it was quite the ordeal.

question: Hi, gals!!! I was just wondering if anyone else has experienced their premie baby changing his or her own eating and sleeping habits? He started out by sleeping longer in between meals. And then he increased his intake a few days later. He was eating 3 to 3 1/2 oz. every 3 to 4 hours. Now, he's eating 4 to 4 1/2 ounces or more every 4 to 6 hours. He was born on Jan. 31st. Is it time for him to sleep longer between meals already? I guess I let his little body decide, or should I call a nurse helpline? Just wondering.I guess maybe no worries since he also increased his intake??? Thanks, ladies!!!
title: Baby Changing His Own...???
